TopicTitle: What did you do in KSP1 today?

Articles.Content: Tried to learn my new joystick. Started a new save to be safe. Can't do anything at this time. Jeb, learn this for me.

Three concepts I built today:

The last performed the best, but It's kind of ugly.

Test flew a few things.

Crashed things.

Back to the VAB!

Took a break today from planning my grand tour around Jool with a pit stop at Dres and launched a probe at Kerbol. Since it's going to the sun, I thought it'd be appropriate to make it solar powered with Ion engines.

The Kerbol I:
That looks beautiful.

I launched 30+ ton power core up to my space station. Whew. It was well inside capabilities of my medium launcher, but for some reason it insisted on breaking the struts and smashing everything below to pieces. Then i launched new interplanetary nuclear stage into orbit. For now it's sitting docked to the station. Then i've launched my kethane/magnetometric probe from Ike's orbit towards Dres. Unfortunately i forgot to y'know, actually scan for antimatter inside Duna's system. Now i have to send another sat or two there.

Edited September 15, 2013 by Scotius

Played with insanely fast planes.

This one is so fast it has to pitch down to stay in the atmosphere. I knew it could be done I just now got around to building one of these nutty things for myself.

annnd I didn't pitch down quite enough.

Also just found out that you can double click on a window in IVA to look out of it.
Beginning another attempt at landing on MÃƒÂ¼n. Taking it slow this time, so far just put a ship into Kerban orbit.
I flew around Kerbin.

Got the Mun shuttle program off to an inauspicious start by landing on a slope a fair hike from Mun Base Alpha, getting panicked about fuel levels in trying to find a flattish place to land before finally dropping the thing properly into the terrain and breaking it. So Mun Base Alpha has a population of eight now. The shuttle is the original Mun lander and its Alpha+ launch platform which has been replaced by the X-Wing series of launchers, so it's probably time to uprate the lander/launcher combination

The manned Mun rover has found a nice flat area about 5km away that will serve well as a second base and landing area.

Managed to place a manned rover on Minmus on a lake on the other side of Minmus to the existing base, so that's been flagged for a second base. The rover is 'challenging' to drive in Minmus' low-G environment, surviving a couple of tight turn induced rolls, so a rethink will be needed for further Minmus and interplanetary rovers.
I can't get a kerbal on the mun or build a working air plane but I can build a huge star-trek ship in orbit ...somethings wrong I'm going backwards.....o.O
Flew around in my B2. Also ordered a Joystick.

Here is a shot of the KSV Kerbin in its current state. I docked the final outer (communications and fuel) pod, and have the first engine pod on its way to a rendezvous.

This picture is the result of nine successful launches (and about half a dozen failures). I have one fuel pod (the four inner orange tanks) that I need to redock because it is turned about 2.5 degrees so only one of the three docking ports are properly attached. I believe all the rest are connected as intended. Once I get the first engine pod docked (at the other end) I'll find out how much ÃŽâ€V it has.

Mapped the Kethane deposits on the Mun today. Left it running while I went to work. Came home to a beautiful map. Turns out my existing Munar base sits atop a respectable Kethane deposit. Time to launch a manned mining ship!
I explored the vast trench at the northern pole of Moho. Got pretty deep in before the camera decided to reorient itself thus causing me to loose control of my orientation and crash.

Installed the first Kerbostationary satellite of my network.

More or less above the continent where KSC is located, the super camera on board can be used to watch launches. A second one will be needed to watch circularisation burns.

The Shtuule overshot KSC again, but felling confident after last time's 180 degree turn, I aimed for airstrip island. And actually made it.

First successful landing there since we lost the nice wide beach. As you can see, runways don't like me.

Speaking of runways, I sent a crew down the end of the KSC one to replace the marker. They should've been quicker.

I bought a used Alienware laptop with a 4 thread i5 processor, and 4 core NVidia GPU. This will replace my current single core Toshiba. Editing CRAFTs has been quite tedius, waiting for loading on every change. I expect my productivity to go up an order of magnitude. Hopefully a commensurate increase in quality as well for y'all. I live on the 'road' a lot, and over half my creative time is spent that way.

The recent pic I posted will be the first thing I intend to finish. Larger parts counts have been nearly impossible for me to work with. Anyway, coming up with a new idea is like 1% of a good craft. 99% is loading the craft. flying, loading in the editor over and over and over. Fine tuning. I have killed a lot of days off with this dumb Toshiba. I am really looking forward to the upgrade.
On my new rig, I started the process of building a [very rough!] Kerbalized ISS.

I sent a mapping a kethane scanning satellite out to Dres, and completed a full map and kethane grids of it. I then completely mapped Duna's mun Ike, with a satellite put in orbit yesterday. Then I made a stupid mistake while docking an observation module to my space station, I put the docking port on the wrong way round
^^I think everyone has made that mistake at least once.

Chillin' at my pad...

...all 172 tons of it. Just put it up today.

Yesterday I supersized one of my existing spaceplane designs. It's now over 164 tons with just over 10,000 fuel.

Now I'm testing it's range. The 100 ton version easily gets to Duna and back, this one is aiming for the moons of jool!

Designed the outline of my second attempt at a Mono return craft:

The Honolulu.

Currently trying to design a launch vehicle big enough to lift the core module (The middle orange tank, plus lander, plus the side-connecting Docking Port Snrs) though I might have to send the lander up as a seperate module if I can't lift the 100-or-so ton monster.

I made the KVOPP-788

Link to thread : http://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/showthread.php/50037-Say-Hello-to-the-newest-member-of-the-KVOP-family!?p=650949#post650949
